t: The Way of the Righteous and the Wicked
Blessed*pn is the man who*ld walks not in the counsel of the wicked, nor*ln stands in the way of sinners, nor*ld sits in the seat of scoffers;
but*ln his delight is in the law of the Lord,*s and*ld on his law he meditates day and night.
He*pn is like a tree planted*ld by streams of water that*ln yields its fruit in its season, and*ld its leaf does not wither. In*ln all that he does, he prospers.
The*ln wicked are not so, but*ld are like chaff that the wind drives away.
Therefore*pn the wicked will not stand in the judgment, nor*ld sinners in the congregation of the righteous;
for*ln the Lord*s knows the way of the righteous, but*ld the way of the wicked will perish.
